text: in olden times when the whishing still
helped there was a dense forest that
contained trees that were sky high with
clustered green leaves among them there
was a little pine in the center forest
who was always discontent
despite its ability to be evergreen I am
the shortest tree in this entire forest
and I got ugly thin needles instead of
leaves a creation of God couldn't get
any worse said the discontented little
pine to himself and there appeared a
grunting fail and happy for a
while and I have found that you are
discontent every time yes very I am and
I couldn't help it okay I want you a
fish ask me something that would make
you happy
pine tree saw it for a while
ah I wish I could get leaves made above
gold so that I shall be the most
precious tree of all all right so shall
you receive said the fairy and chanted
the magic words
the little pine got its golden leaves
and the fairy vanished
I'm so happy that I'm the precious tree
in the entire forest later that day they
came a woodsman and he stopped by the
little pine
holy moly is this for real
oh the boots man cut down every single
leaf and flat
leaving the little pine bear to the
breeze the little pines started crying
and the fairy appeared again don't worry
little pine
let me grant you anything that would
make you feel content the little pine
thought for a while again and I want
leaves made above glasses so that nobody
would take that away as you wish my
little vine the fairy again chanted the
magic words and banished the little pine
on getting leaves made up of glasses got
very excited I look a tractor like ever
before on the same day
Oh God my leaves they're all gone again
cried the little pine
[Music]
don't worry you can still have one last
wish now I want clustered leaves just
like the rest of the trees the fairy
granted its wish and banished again
forever this time
the little pine thought carefully this
time not so late a goat stopped by the
little pines regretted all his mistake
and cried for his needles back and
without showing up the very grunted its
wish and little pine got its needles
again
[Music]
months rode by and it was the snowing
winter season every single tree in the
forest has shredded their leaves due to
the season change but the little pine
stayed ever clean like always and was
very content with being ownself this
there was once a long time ago an honest
and hard-working shoemaker who through
no fault of his own grew so poor that he
had nothing left in the world but enough
leather to make only one pair of shoes
he cut the shoes out before he went to
bed that night thinking that he would
finish them the next day rising early
the next morning he hurried to his work
bench and found to his amazement that
the shoes were already made and finished
he took them in hand and examine them
closely there was not one fall stitch in
the whole job all was so neat and true
that it could only have been done
master workman the shoemaker called to
his wife excitedly and she hurried in to
Marvell also at the excellent
workmanship though she could not explain
how it had come about sometime later a
man came into the shop and tried on the
shoes they are the most comfortable
shoes I have ever worn he exclaimed and
so pleased was he with their good looks
that he gladly paid more than the usual
price for them the poor shoemaker
promptly went out to buy more leather
which as it turned out was enough to
make two more pairs of shoes that
evening he cut out the shoes and laid
them out neatly so that he could begin
afresh the next day imagine his joy and
surprise the next morning to discover
that he was saved all the trouble was
already done soon after two customers
came in and bought both pairs of shoes
what fine stitches they exclaimed and
how well they are made now the shoemaker
had money enough to buy leather for four
pairs of shoes which of course he did
the next morning four pairs of neatly
finished shoes will wedding as the
shoemaker entered his shop and so it
went on for some time
whatever was cut out in the evening was
worked up by daybreak and customers came
in eagerly to buy the shoes
soon the shoemaker and his wife were not
poor anymore
one evening just before Christmas and he
had cut out some shoes as usual
the shoemaker sent to his wife let us
stay up tonight to see who it is that
helps us in this fine way the wife
agreed readily and so leaving a dim
light burning they hid themselves in a
corner of the room behind a curtain at
the stroke of midnight two little elves
came in they sat down at the shoemaker's
bench took all the work that was cut out
and so their tiny fingers began to
stitch and sew and Hammer so quickly
that the shoemakers eyes opened wide in
wonderment they never stopped for a
moment until everything was finished
well then they arranged the shoes and
neat little rows on the bench and they
scampered away as quickly and it's idle
nice the next morning the shoemakers
wife said to her husband
[Music]
made us rich and we should show our
gratitude by doing something for them
did you notice that they wore no clothes
with not a thing to cover them they must
be very cold
I'll make them shirts and coats and
trousers and hats and perhaps even knit
them a pair of stockings you shall make
each of them a tiny pair of shoes a
wonderful plan agreed the shoemaker they
both went to work and by the end of the
day the presents were ready then instead
of the cutout work which was usually
placed on the bench the good couple laid
out the gifts and hid themselves to
await the coming of the little men at
midnight the elves came in hopping and
skipping and looking about for the
leather when they found the neat little
garments that had been put out for them
though they laughed and chuckled with
delight they dressed themselves in the
twinkling of an eye and then they danced
and capered about singing tonight we do
not need to so we have fine clothes so
we'll go and with that they danced out
of the door and over the green laughing
merrily the shoemaker and his wife never
saw them again but the good luck that
the elves had brought remained with them
for the rest of their lives
[Music]
English
[Music]
